title.narrative: Nexus Project Peru: NL-PE expert support for implementation of Santa Eulalia scoping mission water, energy and food security (WEF)

description.narrative: Peru, together with the Netherlands, are part of the UN High Level Panel on Water (HLWP) and both are convening countries of the Global Commission on Adaptation. The Water Energy and Food Security (WEF) nexus approach fit in the overall national and international policy ambitions of both countries to ensure efficient use of natural resources and solve climate change challenges.The project complements and facilitates the implementation of the scoping mission of the project “WEF Nexus in the Santa Eulalia river basin in Lima, Peru. This mission is implemented by Deltares (water), TNO (energy) and Wageningen University (food) in a digital format due to the travel restrictions imposed by the COVID 19 pandemic. The purpose of the scoping mission is to better understand the current situation in the Santa Eulalia river basin, to consult with the key stakeholders and to identify the current and future problems related to the water, agriculture and energy sectors. This to be able to formulate more precisely the objectives, scope and deliverables of the PSD WEF nexus study for Santa Eulalia river basin planned for 2021. The WEF project will help reduce and/or avoid potential trade-offs over the use of increasingly limited water (surface water and groundwater), energy, land and food resources and will promote a better management of these resources at the local, regional and national level.This project provides local and Dutch technical and operational support to the Netherlands embassy in Lima for a successful implementation of the digital scoping missions.

title.narrative: Number of identified opportunities for investment and/or follow-up PSD projects - Total

comment.narrative: (1) Under the umbrella of MERECE local base projects can be oriented to close gaps in water and sanitation and to ensure water security for local agriculture and water based energy production. (2) Multipurpose infrastructure like reservoirs that includes aquaculture, and water treatment facilities designed considering natural based solutions, that can contribute to aquifer recharge. (3) Number of selected initiatives need in the pipeline of MERESE and SEDAPAL need to be updated (4) In the mid and lower basin of Santa Eulalia, drop irrigation and crop selection could be foreseen. For example, Pitahaya which is drought resistant. title.narrative: Increased impact of an existing PSD project

comment.narrative: Follow up of the energy project: MAG18PE01 ENERGY which was completed in February 2021.

Proposal for follow up PSD projects: agricultural smallholders in terms of: sustainability, innovation, technology transformation, competitivity, access to markets (niches), management of impact on hydrological stress or deforestation.
PKB21PE-03: The Agriculture/Food sector in Santa Eulalia sub-basinL aims to 1) quantify and analyse the trade-offs identified during the scoping mission; 2) identify concrete pilot project in the horticulture sector; and 3) enhance the knowledge and skills of farmers to enable them to mitigate the trade-offs and develop and implement the pilot project. PKB21PE-02: The Energy sector in Santa Eulalia sub-basin: aims to 1) quantify and analyse the trade-offs identified during the scoping mission; 2) identify concrete pilot project in the (renewable) energy sector; and 3) enhance the knowledge and skills of policy makers and private sector to enable them to mitigate the trade-offs and develop and implement the pilot project. PKB21PE-01: The Water sector in Santa Eulalia sub-basin: aims to 1) quantify and analyse the trade-offs identified during the scoping mission; 2) identify concrete pilot project in the green infrastructure water sector; and 3) enhance the knowledge and skills of policy makers and private sector to enable them to mitigate the trade-offs and develop and implement the pilot project.

title.narrative: Number of people directly reached - Local
Number of parties formally starting a business collaboration and/or partnership - Dutch private parties
Number of parties formally starting a business collaboration and/or partnership - Local private parties

comment.narrative: Working relationships have been established with the hydroplant owners and operators in Santa Eulalia and the Water, Climate and Development Programme (PACyD).

title.narrative: Number of parties formally starting a business collaboration and/or partnership - Local public parties

comment.narrative: Working relationships have been established with the national Water Authority(ANA), regional office Lima of the Ministry of Development, Agriculture and Irrigation (DRAL), Potable Water and Sewerage Services of Lima (SEDAPAL), local Water Authority (ALA)
